abstract: Consider the usual graph Qn defined by the n-dimensional cube (having 2n vertices and n2n − 1 edges). We prove that if G is an induced subgraph of Qn with more than 2n − 1 vertices then the maximum degree in G is at least (. On the other hand, we construct an example which shows that this is not true for maximum degree larger than.
meta: September 1988Journal of Combinatorial Theory Series A 49(1):180–187
